pullRequest.title: CORE,RPC: Unified password manager modules logic
pullRequest.bodyText:
Added GenericPasswordManagerModule as default implementation
for password manager logic replacing former implementation
from inside of managePassword(), which was removed.


Each outer API method to manage password now calls proper
module / implementation.


Method UsersManagerBl.getPasswordManagerModule() is now public
and always returns module for namespace or generic implementation.
If instantiation fails, then exception is thrown.


Removed generateAccount() from UsersManagerImpl, it is now
only in Bl, reusing bl method to get module.


Removed long time deprecated createPassword() methods from all APIs.


Removed unnecessary and incomplete javadoc from bl methods.


Added createAlternativePassword() and deleteAlternativePassword()
to PasswordManagerModule.


Modified logic in UsersManagerBlImpl to use modules instead of
shared manageAlternativePassword().


Added generic implementation for alternative passwords inside
GenericPasswordManagerModule.


New Einfra/DusambaPasswordManagerModule and will pass necessary data as ENV
variables for the new pwd manager script, avoiding STDIN.


Both modules append their namespace after pwd manager script path, allowing custom
implementation (unless its /bin/true). On deployment symlink or new script must be present.

nodes.bodyText: I would use this String as constant.

beforeCommit.message:
CORE: Simplified exit code handling of alt password managers

- We have simpler scripts for alternative passwords and they
  exit 1 on any error. They log locally and return no info
  back to the perun. Hence we can simply throw proper
  exception on any non zero exit code based on triggered
  action.
- Temporarily disable appending ".einfra" to standard password
  manager script name, to ease up deployment. We don't have
  updated scripts on production yet.

commit.message:
CORE,RPC: Unified password manager modules logic

- Added GenericPasswordManagerModule as default implementation
  for password manager logic replacing former implementation
  from inside of managePassword(), which was removed.
- Each outer API method to manage password now calls proper
  module / implementation.
- Method UsersManagerBl.getPasswordManagerModule() is now public
  and always returns module for namespace or generic implementation.
  If instantiation fails, then exception is thrown.
- Removed generateAccount() from UsersManagerImpl, it is now
  only in Bl, reusing bl method to get module.
- Removed long time deprecated createPassword() methods from all APIs.
- Removed unnecessary and incomplete javadoc from bl methods.

CORE: Alternative passwords logic moved to PasswordManagerModule

- Added createAlternativePassword() and deleteAlternativePassword()
  to PasswordManagerModule.
- Modified logic in UsersManagerBlImpl to use modules instead of
  shared manageAlternativePassword().
- Added generic implementation for alternative passwords inside
  GenericPasswordManagerModule.

CORE: Added stub module for einfra namespace

- Added EinfraPasswordManagerModule, which is extending standard
  GenericPasswordManagerModule. It will perform custom checks
  on login format and password strength.
- It modifies default password manager script path by appending
  ".einfra" to the script name, so that each namespace can
  have custom implementation.

CORE: Implemented password manager module for du-samba

- New DusambaPasswordManagerModule will pass necessary data as ENV
  variables for the new pwd manager script, avoiding STDIN.
- We will do the same for einfra later.

CORE: Custom implementation of alt password manager in einfra

- Only create/delete param is passed to the command directly
- We now pass all other necessary properties as ENV variables,
  so the script doesn't have to ask perun for additional data.
- We do not set empty env variables.

CORE: Fixed samba-du namespace name

- Fixed all "du-samba" to "samba-du", including module name.

CORE: Simplified exit code handling of alt password managers

- We have simpler scripts for alternative passwords and they
  exit 1 on any error. They log locally and return no info
  back to the perun. Hence we can simply throw proper
  exception on any non zero exit code based on triggered
  action.
- Temporarily disable appending ".einfra" to standard password
  manager script name, to ease up deployment. We don't have
  updated scripts on production yet.
